attributes.action: Stop Quarantine for travellers coming to the UK!
attributes.additional_details:
Take off the quarantine for travellers coming to the UK.
This is just another way to completely destroy the UK Economy and make people suffer not only tourist people but people who depend or profit greatly from external tourism.
Most of the countries are taking off the quarantine slowly, and making things getting back to normal, getting ready for tourists and summer season the meanwhile the UK does completely another way around and puts quarantine for tourist. WHERE IS THE LOGIC?!
attributes.background:
Stop Quarantine for travellers coming to the UK!
There are better ways for this! Countries takedown quarantines already, its summertime, tourists want to enjoy their life and live their life,same as people who depend on tourism from the outside UK. How about just test each tourist on their expense?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Do not enforce a compulsory quarantine on people arriving in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320329

Start screening every person who enters UK for Coronavirus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301188

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
